711911f.text:
The old Morgue, 400 East 29th Street,at S. E. corner of First Avenue. This will be replaced by a six story building.
About 1905.
May be reproduced.

731849f-a.title: Hospitals - Bellevue Hospital [operated by the city for the poor sick and those picked up in the streets.]
731849f-a.folder: 1st Avenue Between 26th and 29th Streets (East), Manhattan, N.Y.

711908f-a.text:
29th Street, south side, west from 330 East 29th, west of First Avenue. In the left centre is the parochial school of the
Carmelite Roman Catholic Church.
June 24, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

711909f-a.text:
29th Street, south side, east of First Avenue, with a clearing on the north side, showing the Bellevue Hospital laundry and
other buildings.
April 27, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

711910f-a.text:
29th Street, north side, east of First Avenue, looking across the future site of the Psychopathic Hospital to the lumber
yard on the north side of 30th street.
april 30, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

711912f-a.text:
Fidelio Brewery, 29th Street at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of First Avenue. The S.W. corner of First avenue and
29th Street is shown at the left.
April 31, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

731854f-a.title: Hospitals - Bellevue Hospital - [The morgue building.]
731854f-a.text:
Bellevue Hospital: A view showing the southern side of the Morgue Building; which is located at the S.E. corner of First Ave., and East 29th Street.
February 4, 1937.
W.P.A. Photo.
City Wide Project.

731859f-b.title: Hospitals - Bellevue Hospital - [Old hospital building.]
731859f-b.text:
Bellevue Hospital: A set of three showing a southerly view of the old Hospital building demolitions which are on the easterly side of First Ave; the photographer standing at East 29th and later 28th Streets. Show across the tops of same are the upper portions of the new Administration and the Out Patient Buildings.

May 8, 1938.

P.L. Sperr
731859f-b.folder: 1st Avenue Between 28th and 29th Streets (East), Manhattan, N.Y.

731859f-a.text:
Bellevue Hospital: A set of three showing a southerly view of the old Hospital building demolitions which are on the easterly side of First Ave; the photographer standing at East 29th and later 28th Streets. Show across the tops of same are the upper portions of the new Administration and the Out Patient Buildings.

731859f-a.folder: 1st Avenue Between 28th and 29th Streets (East), Manhattan, N.Y.

707556f-b.text:
First Avenue, north from E. 29th Street, showing mainly the easterly side of this thoroughfare above 30th Street (seen on the right).  The smoke stacks seen in the distance are atop the N.Y. Steam Co. plant and the Consolidated Edison Company generating unit.  Note the 34th Street "El" spur crossing the Avenue.  Exclusive of the removal of the latter feature, this view in 1936 remains the same.
No. 2 shows only a portion of the area seen in View No. 1 Note at the right the clearance (shown solely in View No. 3) where the present Psychopathic Hospital unit of the Bellevue stands.
September 10, 1928.
Views 2 & 3: April 27, 1930.
P.L. Sperr
